meanings.definition: To selfishly monopolize or keep something for oneself.
meanings.sent1: Tom would always bogart the toys during playtime.
meanings.sent2: Please don't bogart all the snacks; leave some for others.
meanings.sent3: At the picnic, Sarah tried to bogart all the sandwiches, but we caught her!
meanings.sent4: The bully would bogart the swings at the park, not letting anyone else play.
meanings.sent5: In the game, players must strategize to bogart the limited resources.

meanings.definition: A person who selfishly monopolizes or keeps something for themselves.
meanings.sent1: Don't be a bogart and share the toys with your friends.
meanings.sent2: The bogart in our group always hogs the remote control.
meanings.sent3: During the movie night, John turned into a bogart, not letting anyone pick the film.
meanings.sent4: The bogart of the office fridge claimed all the space with their lunches.
meanings.sent5: The bogart of the classroom kept all the markers in their desk.
